lines.text: [first lines]
You need to write a new story on me, don't you? Here you go - here is something to start from...
Aunt Polly knows that Tom will end up in prison because of all the dime novels he devours.
Can't you imagine how delightful it would be up in heaven playing on a golden harp?
Do you aim to go up there? Then I'd rather go someplace else.
Miss Watson preaches for a long time on Moses, as if he were her best friend. And that's even though she never knew him!
The blood trail can be followed straight down to the lake. My own little Huck first got murdered and then drowned afterward.
If Massa Huck alive, can I stay here with you? They sold me to a bad man and I run off.
I'm most certainly alive! Of course you can stay here. I appoint you secretary of the navy! Build me a ship where we can sleep at night.
I'll go into town to get some news. Maybe they found some of me in the river and buried me. That'd be good to know.
What did you say your name was?
Doris, Enid, Lucy, Mabel Williams.
I thought you said your name was Sarah, and a whole bunch of other names.
I have a lot of names, so many that I change a little between them. Some I use on Sundays - and others on weekdays.
Yes. Yes. Goodbye dear Sarah, George, Peter, Alexander. Just don't forget what your name is next time.
My great-great-great grandfather was the eldest son of the Duke of Bridgewater. He drank himself to death, the dearl soul.
Dear Duke Bilgewater, let me comfort you... I can see that there is something in your eye that is very reminiscent of the picture I have seen of Duke Bilgewater... on a whiskey bottle!
Will you allow me to recite Romeo and Juliet? To augment my imagination, I ask you to be Juliet... to whom I confess my young Lo-ove.
But if I'm Juliet, won't my bald head and long whiskers distract you?

[after the King falls into the river while reciting Romeo and Juliet]
The idea was that you become Juliet, not the fountain.
Dear Lord, will you save Jim? If you do that, I promise you that I will write to Miss Watson and tell her where I am. So, if you absolutely want me to be back with Miss Watson, Jim has to be rescued.
Why on earth do you want to free him when he is free to begin with?
Are you fools? We did it for the adventure! And now Huck and I will go on another one.
[last lines]

It's better that I tell the truth, then maybe Aunt Sally will adopt me and make me an educated young man, so I can go back to Mary Jane. And this I swear, Mary Jane will someday see me as a grown-up educated man.
